steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. This can be accessed from Start > All Apps (or All Programs) > Firefox on Windows and Applications > Firefox on OSX.

steps.title: Access the Add-ons interface.
steps.content: Access the Add-ons interface. Go to Settings (☰) > Add-ons . This page will display any installed extensions. From here you can update, remove, or search for new extensions and add-ons. This page can also be accessed by typing “about:addons” into the address bar.

steps.title: Search for add-ons.
steps.content: Search for add-ons. Select "Get Add-ons" if it is not selected by default. Select the search bar and enter your desired extension.

steps.title: Press the “Install” button next to your desired extension.
steps.content: Press the “Install” button next to your desired extension. Firefox will automatically download and install the add-on/extension. Firefox will also notify you if a restart is required to use your new extension. An icon for your newly installed add-on will appear in the toolbar on the right. This is often a quick way to access that extension’s settings. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. This can be accessed from Start > All Apps (or All Programs) > Firefox on Windows and Applications > Firefox on OSX.

steps.title: Search the internet for Firefox extensions.
steps.content: Search the internet for Firefox extensions. Some Firefox add-ons can be acquired outside of the built-in add-on interface. Navigate to the website that hosts your desired extension file and download it. Firefox extension files use the .xpi filetype (cross-platform installer). XPI files can be acquired from external installation links by right-clicking and selecting “Save Link As…” if you prefer to install manually or want installers for archiving purposes. Firefox uses the desktop as the default download destination.

steps.title: Drag and drop XPI file in Firefox window.
steps.content: Drag and drop XPI file in Firefox window. A notification will appears to the left of the address bar that an external source wants to install an add-on.

steps.title: Verify Installation.
steps.content: Verify Installation. Press “Install” in the notification and restart Firefox if necessary.

steps.title: Access the add-ons interface controls.
steps.content: Access the add-ons interface controls. From the add-ons interface, press Settings (gear icon) next to the add-on search bar. This will open a menu of add-on specific controls.

steps.title: Select “Install Add-on from File…” from the menu.
steps.content: Select “Install Add-on from File…” from the menu. This will bring up a file explorer window.

steps.title: Browse to the .xpi file and press Open.
steps.content: Browse to the .xpi file and press Open. A notification will appear to the left of the address bar that an external source wants to install an add on.

steps.title: Verify installation.
steps.content: Verify installation. Press “Install” in the notification and restart Firefox if necessary.
